required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Analysis of Ocular Deviations Between Dominant and Non-dominant Eye Using Video-oculography (VOG) in Intermittent Exotropia
clinical_study.official_title: The Analysis of Ocular Deviations Between Dominant and Non-dominant Eye Using Video-oculography (VOG) in Intermittent Exotropia

brief_summary.textblock: Fifteen subjects with intermittent exotropia were included. The subjects were asked to fixate on a black-on-white optotype at 1 m, which subtended a visual angle of 50 min of arc, equating to a Snellen optotype of 20/200. The video files and data about ocular deviations were obtained using VOG with alternate cover test. Investigators analyzed angles of ocular deviations in dominant and non-dominant eyes, compared with values of VOG and deviation angles of the alternative prism cover test.

primary_outcome.measure: The angles of ocular deviations between dominant and non-dominant eye using VOG with alternate cover
primary_outcome.description: The angles of ocular deviations between dominant and non-dominant eye using VOG with alternate cover

arm_group.description: Measurement: Video-oculography(VOG) measure and analyze angles of ocular deviations between dominant and non-dominant eye using VOG with alternate cover.
Measurement: Alternative prism cover test(APCT) measure and analyze angles of ocular deviations between dominant and non-dominant eye using APCT

intervention.description: measure and analyze angles of ocular deviations between dominant and non-dominant eye using VOG with alternate cover.
measure and analyze angles of ocular deviations between dominant and non-dominant eye using APCT

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Visual acuity >= 1.0/1.0
- Intermittent exotropia
- Cooperative
Exclusion Criteria:
- Other eye disease
- Have hyperopia, myopia > 2 diopter
- Have horizontal strabismus > 50 prism diopter
- Not cooperative, no agree
